title: Authority of examiner of drivers to suspend, revoke, cancel, mark the medical certification status as not-certified, or downgrade commercial driver's license or permit
context: §286-241.4 Authority of examiner of drivers to suspend, revoke, cancel, mark the medical certification status as not-certified, or downgrade commercial driver&rsquo;s license or permit. (a) The examiner of drivers may suspend, revoke, cancel, mark the medical certification status as not-certified, or downgrade any commercial driver&rsquo;s license or commercial learner&rsquo;s permit without a hearing when the examiner of drivers has probable cause to believe that the licensee or permittee is disqualified under section 286-240. (b) The examiner of drivers shall deny or suspend any commercial driver&rsquo;s license or commercial learner&rsquo;s permit pursuant to the terms of section 576D-13 when the examiner of drivers receives certification from the child support enforcement agency that the licensee or permittee is not in compliance with an order of support as defined in section 576D-1 or has failed to comply with a subpoena or warrant relating to a paternity or child support proceeding. Both the licensee or permittee and the licensee&rsquo;s or permittee&rsquo;s employer shall be notified of the denial or suspension. &copy; Upon suspension, revocation, or cancellation of the commercial driver&rsquo;s license or commercial learner&rsquo;s permit, the driver&rsquo;s license or learner&rsquo;s permit shall be surrendered to the examiner of drivers by the licensee or permittee. (d) Unless otherwise provided by law, the licensing authority shall reinstate, renew, or approve the license only upon receipt of an authorization from the child support enforcement agency, the office of child support hearings, or the family court. [L 1990, c 342, pt of §3; am L 1995, c 114, §6; am L 1997, c 293, §13; am L 2009, c 46, §3; am L 2011, c 121, §6; am L 2013, c 114, §12]
